creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
I experience a slow problem with POST using netscape 4.7.
(It doesn't happen with GET method which response back immediately)

The POST method seems take forever .... so slow ..... to give me back a
response. However if I click on the title bar of the netscape 
(or other windows), it will give back the response immediately. 
Strange ???

Here is some comments from another observers: 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: http://mikal.org/interests/java/tomcat_users/msg03421.html
>From: Andreas Junghans <andreas.junghans@isb-ka.de> 
>Subject: Re: Slow POST? 
>Date: Wed, 26 Jul 2000 16:15:19 +0200 
>
>>> When I access a JSP via GET, I get an immediate response. When the same
>>> page is requested via POST, there is random delay up to about 30 seconds
>>> (also when reloading the page, so it's not the time needed to compile
>>> the JSP). I wonder where this delay comes from? 
>>> My configuration:
>>> Tomcat 3.1
>>> Apache 1.3.12 (Win32)
>>> Windows NT 4.0 SP5
>>> Netscape Navigator 4.7
>
>
>The delay mentioned only occurs with Navigator (4.7) as client, not with
>IE. I've browsed through the Tomcat sources and some servlet resources
>on the net, and I found something about Navigator adding extra CR-LFs
>after a POST request that are not allowed by HTTP. Could this be causing
>the delay (maybe when reading from the ServletInputStream)? Has anybody
>else experienced the same problem? Is this Tomcat specific?
>
>I would really appreciate any help. Thanks in advance.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The extra CRLF has been fixed in 3.2 and 3.3, it shouldn't happen any more.
Please reopen the bug and add a WAR file that can be used to reproduce if you
still see the problem.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com

text:
this bug is still present in 3.2.1 final!

Application") to reproduce it, i had the same problems with netscape 4.75. 
clicking on the title-bar immediately gives back the response, really strange!

text:
Costin mentioned that this bug should be fixed in 3.2.
However, we still see it appearing sometimes in 3.2.1.
I was just wondering if anyone else is still seeing this bug.
creator: lichtin@bivio.com
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
Given the date of Costin's post, I think he meant Tomcat 3.2 nightly.
I need to return this bug to a "resolved" state, so I'm marking it fixed.
Please try a current version of Tomcat to see if the problem still exists.
If so, enter a new bug report against the version you try.  Also, please
attach as simple web application that demonstrates your problem so we
can concentrate of fixing the bug rather than duplicating it.  Thanks.

creator: jonathon_parker@1mind.com
text:
I am experiencing an identical problem With Netscape 4.08 on Windows 2000 using 
tomcat 3.2.3 final.  There is a delay of a minute or more after a post. Oddly 
though, if I shift focus to a different browser window or application, Netscape 
stops hanging and loads the page.

Other java server pages on the web I have viewed (www.mlb.com is a great 
example), do not hang.
